results.title: The Printing industry
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the four methods of printing -letterpress, lithograph, gravure and silkscreen and pre-production stages such as typesetting, and composing of type, proofing and the plate making. Also how to go about getting a job in the industry.

results.title: The Printed circuit story
results.brief_description: Shows the complete manufacture of printed circuits as well as recommended tools and approved repair techniques for replacing components, soldering, and servicing of printed wiring.

results.title: The Principles of baking
results.brief_description: Shows that all baked products of flour mixtures have a common ingredient - flour. To this framework are added other ingredients dependent on the kind of product desired. The factors described in the films are (1) leavening agents, (2) methods of combining ingredients, and (3) oven temperatures used.

results.title: The Principles and applications of atomic spectra
results.creator_credit: Katrina Rank and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: The film begins with a brief summary of the electromagnetic spectrum, and then makes the point that when electrons in atoms lose or gain energy, radiation with wavelengths ranging from the X-ray to the near infra-red region is emitted or absorbed.

results.title: The Principles and application of work sampling
results.creator_credit: Industrial Education Films and Wallace J. Richardson
results.brief_description: Analyses the limitations of traditional work measurement techniques, and demonstrates the advantages of work sampling. The film shows its applications in the engineering, manufacturing, warehousing, office and other areas of industry.

results.title: The Princess and the wonderful weaver
results.brief_description: The progress of Britain’s wool cloth industry from traditional handworking through invention of the spinning jenny, flying shuttle and powered loom to modern fully automated production. The story is traced in a blend of animation and live action. Searching for her Fairy Prince, the Princess models her way through a range of modern fashions, all styled in wool.

results.title: The Princess's wedding day
results.brief_description: Highlights of the wedding day of HRH Princess Elizabeth and Philip Mountbatten. Shows the procession of Elizabeth and George VI to Westminster Abbey, the marriage ceremony, the Royal couple with the King, Queen and Queen Mother waving to cheering crowds from the balcony at Buckingham Palace. Narrated by Anna Neagle.

results.title: The Prince of Central Park
results.creator_credit: Lorimar Film Entertainment and Harvey Hart
results.brief_description: Central Park, New York, inhabited nightly by muggers, rapists and killers, becomes the unlikely venue for two recently orphaned children, Jay Jay and Laurie to find a home. They do however, with Jay Jay proclaiming himself ‘The Prince of Central Park’. Into their world enters a lonely widow (Ruth Gordon), who is eager to share their sense of family and belonging. Based on the novel by Evan Rhodes.

results.title: The Prince and the pauper
results.creator_credit: Walter J Hucker, A P I Television Productions and Chris Cuddington
results.brief_description: Set in Tudor London, Edward IV, Price of Wales, is only thirteen years old, yet he is heir to the throne. Some rather unexpected events take place when, for amusement, he changes his clothes with Tom, a pauper, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him. Made for television this animated film is based on the story by American writer, Mark Twain.

results.title: The Prince
results.creator_credit: Bill Jersey and Barr Media Group
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Renaissance”.
Documents the lives and accomplishments of the “Princes” of the Renaissance. Discover the motivations and political solutions of leaders such as Cosimo di Medici, Prince Philip of Spain and Queen Elizabeth of England. Learn about Machiavelli, a maligned political theorist, but one of the most influential figures in the politics of his age. Furthermore, explore the Renaissance leaders legacy that continues to influence today’s statesmen.
